TopicTitle: [WIP] KerbTown v0.13 Beta - Place static buildings, cities, launch sites & more!

Articles.Content:
Hasn't been a problem and I've been pumping out new launch locations in KerbinSide for a couple of months now.

While Kerbtown does work for getting other locations set up, I haven't had any luck in launching from KT launch sites in 0.24.2. Kinda puts a damper on using it...
Of course when i just want to download the mod, the download is gone

Of course when i just want to download the mod, the download is gone

You could always download my fork or HoneyFox's fork

You could always download my fork or HoneyFox's fork

Ooh, lovely. I'll check them out this afternoon, I'd love to be able to use other launch sites again, especially considering the new airport I've been working on in my spare time.

Sketchup and Blender together are fantastic tools for this sort of thing.

Ooh, lovely. I'll check them out this afternoon, I'd love to be able to use other launch sites again, especially considering the new airport I've been working on in my spare time.

http://i.imgur.com/g4QJIiK.jpg

Sketchup and Blender together are fantastic tools for this sort of thing.

That looks awesome!

You could always download my fork or HoneyFox's fork

This is the first I've heard of your fork.

This is the first I've heard of your fork.

I posted it a few pages back, it fixes the timewarp lag issue that comes from there being too many KerbTown objects.

So I definitely want an update to Kerbtown... Just today it completely broke for me in 0.24 as well as 0.23, where it was stable previously.

In both versions the addon instantiates but stops right there, not loading anything ever. It's not as big of a deal in 0.23, but 0.24 is a terrible loss.

I'm very confused because I haven't done anything that should have broken it. I suspect it doesn't like something about my airport (because the issues began when I installed that) but it still makes no sense why...

Edit: Turns out that it was indeed my airport causing havoc in 0.23, but 0.24 is still broken even without the airport. Testing more stuff now.

Edit 2: Looks like the most recent update to your fork is completely broken in 0.24.2, medsouz. Might wanna look into what could be causing it.

Edit 3: Check that, issue still persists when I have my runway installed. It says Kerbin City loaded right... Man am I sick of using this outdated thing...

Edit 4: And Kerbtown is out of all GameData folders for good. Not dealing with it until it is completely, 100% rewritten. Off to do homework now.

Edited September 3, 2014 by OrbitusII

Hmmm could you possibly send me your airport files so I can test it? Also funny that you mention a rewrite as I'm working on one right now.

You could always download my fork or HoneyFox's fork

Thank you

But i've already tried the one that's on this post, and it didn't do anything, i'll try the other one (Did i do something wrong, i just put the folder that's in 'gamedata' into my gamedata, but it didn't do anything :\)

EDIT: I just thought about this, i'm probably stupid, how do you launch on other bases? (I don't have any new parts, or when i click on launch also nothing changes)

EDIT2: Nvm, i already know what i'mforgetting, i'm really stupid...

Um, according to the manual and the zip file structure, "hubs" is extracted into the root directory of ksp?? Not /gamedata?

Um, according to the manual and the zip file structure, "hubs" is extracted into the root directory of ksp?? Not /gamedata?

No, it still goes into GameData. The manual is severely outdated (just like everything else, sadly...) and so it might not get everything right.

No, you need Kerbal Konstructs. Link
